text: Smarsh is a leading regulatory and

compliance company
that helps financial institutions
with their capture, archiving,
and surveillance requirements.

Until 2024, Smarsh operated
our platform on top

of a virtualized layer
on top of AWS services.

And then we made a strategic
shift to move to Amazon EKS
and AWS native services.
So in order to enable that shift, we had

to elevate the skill set of our
organization to empower them
to be ready to operate at scale
for our customers in the new world.

So we launched an AWS
Guild Incubator program
to quickly solve

that skill gap within our
engineering organization.
This program included self-paced learning

through Skill Builder licenses,
instructor-led training

that were both virtual
and in person, as well
as immersion days throughout the globe.

Through the AWS Guild
Incubator program, we were able

to go from zero to one in
training our teams very quickly

and were able to train a
hundred people in four months.
The AWS Guild Incubator program moved the
needle for our employees.
Our employee engagement went up

and our participation
within the engineering
organization increased.
It led to better quality of deliverables,

which meant less time
firefighting, less incidents,
and more time for innovation.

AWS certified employees
develop better quality code.

They develop better features
and products for our customers.
Happy customers renew with Smarsh.
We want to foster a culture
of continuous learning at Smarsh,

and we view this as a
long-term investment into our

engineering organization
that will pay dividends
for many years to come.
